New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history with 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Shohei Ohtani reached 400 total bases, the first player to do so since 2001.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers scored five runs in the seventh inning, including a game-turning two-run homer by Will Smith.
Freddie Freeman was injured late in the game, affecting the team's roster for the postseason.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were aiming to clinch the NL West title and had emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The game was highly anticipated due to the rivalry and the significance for the postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Players and the manager expressed pride in the team's resilience and the victory's impact on their playoff push.
The victory was seen as a pivotal moment in their journey towards the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A sellout crowd of 52,433 attended the game, and the Dodgers had not clinched at home since the 2020 season.
The team's fight and resilience were highlighted as key factors in their win.
Others: The article mentions the retirement of Manny Ramirez attending the game, adding historical context.
